name: Dark Dragonite

abilities.name: Summon Minions
abilities.text: When you play Dark Dragonite from your hand, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pok√©mon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Sometimes called "The God of Destruction." Its wings are able to support it in spite of its massive weight.

strengths: Summon Minions provides incredible bench setup when evolved
No weakness makes it harder to exploit
Giant Tail can deal 70 damage - high for the era
Colorless typing means any energy works
weaknesses: Giant Tail is coin flip dependent - 50% chance to do nothing
70 HP is very low for a Stage 2
Summon Minions only works when played from hand

competitiveHistory: Dark Dragonite's Summon Minions Pokemon Power made it valuable in decks that needed fast bench setup. Getting two Basic Pokemon from your deck when you evolve was powerful, especially for decks relying on bench presence. However, Giant Tail's coin flip reliability issues and low HP for a Stage 2 limited its overall competitive impact. It was primarily used as a tech card for the Pokemon Power rather than as a main attacker.

rulings.ruling: Summon Minions only triggers when Dark Dragonite is played from your hand to evolve a Pokemon. It doesn't work with Pokemon Breeder or when evolved from the discard pile.
You may search for 0, 1, or 2 Basic Pokemon with Summon Minions.
Giant Tail does no damage on tails - you don't flip again or get a second chance.
You must have open Bench spaces to put Pokemon from Summon Minions. If your Bench is full, you can't use the Power.
